title: Braes o' Balquhidder. A novel
author: Aytoun, Douglas.
snippet: As good luck would have it, a most experienced nurse, who had been attending a gentleman (now convalescent), at the Queen's Arms, was already in attendance, and all but formerly installed in her new post by the leading Oban practitioner and Mrs. Wallace.

title: Braes o' Balquhidder. A novel
author: Aytoun, Douglas.
snippet: lunch at the Queen's Arms with Mr. MacNeill and his architect, in order to have a look at the plans of the modern Dunedin, so the women-folks at the Alexandra had the mid-day meal, and more stories and gossip, all to themselves, enjoying their freedom for once with the greatest satisfaction. This arrangement had put Elspeth quite at her ease ; so much so, that when three o'clock brought the gig and her master to the door, she had come to that stage of real enjoyment which, had she known the lines, might have prompted the quotation (slightly altered) :—

title: Here and there in the Home Land. England, Scotland and Ireland as seen by a Canadian. ... Profusely illustrated
author: Haight, Canniff.
snippet: Turning away from these scenes with reluctance, we mount our cart and drive back to Ayr, reaching the Queen's Arms in time for dinner, after which we hurry out to have a look at " auld Ayr," which the poet tells us—

title: Hospitable England in the seventies;
author: Dana, Richard Henry
snippet: I was surprised at the excellence of the collection of pictures by many great masters. Walked from there to Kenilworth, where I lunched at the Queen's Arms. I was enchanted with the old ruins and could hardly tear myself away.

title: The life of Samuel Johnson, LL. D. :
author: Boswell, James
snippet: On Friday, April 6, he carried me to dine at a club, which, at his desire, had been lately formed at the Queen's Arms,
